boat.name: Bona
boat.full_description: Built in by Aldous of Brightlingsea in 1903, 'Bona' is a Thames bawley. She was extensively rebuilt in the 1990s by Ian Smith and regularly participates in events on the East Coast of England, showing a surprising turn of speed on all points of sail.
boat.short_description: 'Bona', a bawley built in 1903 by Aldous of Brightlingsea is frequently seen sailing and racing on the East Coast of England.

for_sales.sales_text:
Fishing no. LO178, Thames Bawley, built by Aldous of Brightlingsea, 1903. LOA: 35’ Beam: 13’ Engine: marinised Peugeot XLD 50hp. Twin hydraulic folding props. Good sail wardrobe. 9 berths. SMEV oven with 4 burners and grill. Heads with shower. Log burner/dual fuel stove with back boiler. Fridge. Previously used for charter, licensed for ten guests. Standing rigging replaced 2015.

Lying Titchmarsh Marina, Essex.
